thread.title: Nicki Minaj isn't sorry about slamming Miley Cyrus
thread.title_full: Nicki Minaj isn't sorry about slamming Miley Cyrus - Entertainment

author: Agencies
title: Nicki Minaj isn't sorry about slamming Miley Cyrus
text:
The rapper says she does not regret slamming Miley Cyrus at this year's VMAs
When a furious Nicki Minaj called out Miley Cyrus at the Video Music Awards (VMAs) for 'disrespecting her' in an interview, she left everyone stunned.


Nicki Minaj 
The rapper had criticised MTV for snubbing her from certain categories. Responding to it, this year's VMAs host, Miley had said, "If you do things with an open heart and you come at things with love, you would be heard and I would respect your statement. But I don't respect your statement because of the anger that came with it."
In a recent interview, Nicki has said that she is not apologetic about her statement and stands by the epic moment which left Miley open-mouthed. She said: "I saw (Miley) just looking at me, with her face screwed up, and I thought, What the...
The fact that you feel upset about me speaking on something that affects black women makes me feel like you have some big ba**s. You're in videos with black men, and you're bringing out black women on your stage, but you don't want to know how black women feel about something that's so important?"
The star had previously tweeted about not being nominated for Video of the Year, saying, "Black women influence pop culture so much but are rarely rewarded for it."
